role: Assistant Professor (Deputy Head of Department, Training Coordinator & Head Mechanics, Structures and Materials)
description: Teaching undergraduate/postgraduate courses in Advanced Mechanics and Continuum Mechanics; supervising student projects and theses; mentoring students in academics and leadership development.

Developed material selection systems for SpaceX Mars missions; created performance metrics for sheet metal qualification; led cross-functional teams as Scrum Master for global casting equipment setup.
Restructured engineering curriculum; managed $0.5M R&D portfolio producing 17 publications for department; mentored students in academic and community initiatives.
Helped established profitable investigative center; conducted 40+ failure analyses generating revenue; managed full-cycle investigations and safety audits.
Led 200+ technicians in aircraft operations; managed logistics for 500+ combat missions; implemented $1M fuel efficiency program; coordinated international exercises.
Managed F-16 mid-life upgrades; optimized inspection processes reducing downtime by 28%; supervised 100+ technicians in aircraft maintenance operations.
